answers.answer: Dear JudyIt seems like you had tests done to rule out medical conditions that may be causing your symptoms. I am not sure whether you had your thyroids checked or not because abnormalities in thyroids can cause those symptoms.  People with depression can have sad mood, fatigue, changes in weight, disturbances in sleep, loss of interest in life and even suicidal ideations. Without adequate evaluation, it is hard to recommend any kind of treatment. If your fear of dying is effecting your functioning, you may need   to consider evaluation by a trained mental health professional. I wish you good luckSincerelyHFHS-M.D.

question: I am 39 years old. I have had recurring symptoms of dizziness, heart palpitations, fatigue, weakness, non-esistent sex drive and just a general feeling of sickness. I am extremely short tempered and irritable.  It has interrupted my abililty to function. I have been tested for everything from mono to diabetes. I had an MRI and blood tests that have come up clean.  The only medical explanation to date was a diagnosis for Epstein Barr.  I constantly think I may be dying.Could it be hormonal?  Is it stress/depression? Could an herbal remedy such as St. Johns wort or Gingko be helpful?Any advice would be appreciated.
title: Stress as it relates to non-existent sex drive and psychosomatic illness
